title: MOOC-Based Short-Intensive Education for Understanding and Caregiving in Dementia

context.prior_knowledge: No basic knowledge of dementia-related topics
context.additional_context: Non-Degree Course for Strengthening Dementia Prevention and Early Response Capabilities, with a Focus on Delivering Practical Knowledge Applicable to Daily Life

learning_goals: Learners can explain dementia symptoms and stage-specific characteristics with over 80% accuracy
Learners propose three practical support strategies for families/caregivers of dementia patients

At the end of a 1-week course, learners create a comparative analysis table of three international dementia response policies (WHO guidelines, Japanese regional care model, Nordic integrated care system), submit a dementia management plan linking local resources (2 medical institutions, 2 welfare facilities, 1+ volunteer group), and achieve â‰¥80 points on an evaluation rubric (40% policy analysis accuracy, 30% resource linkage appropriateness, 30% feasibility)
Learners complete over 75% of microlearning content provided in mobile environments
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
